text: BREAKING: #Louisville Metro Council rejects tax hike, leaving @louisvillemayor Greg Fischer to find millions in service cuts. http://bit.ly/2Cy4pnV  (via @courierjournal)

text:
That’s $20,000,000 more in cuts that #Louisville leaders will now have to find in the next three months.

Not to mention future cuts until 2023 due to rising pension.

@louisvillemayor Greg Fischer’s 3rd term (and his entire legacy) is going to take a big hit.

Period. #LouMayor

text:
Q: What does this mean? 

A: Well, @louisvillemayor, @DemLMC and @LMCRep will have to find $35,000,000 to cut in the upcoming #LouBudget by July 1 rather than $15,000,000 in cuts. #Louisville
author: phillipmbailey

text:
Of the 5 @DemLMC members that the @courierjournal had reported were undecided, 4 (Keisha Dorsey, Mark Fox, @CWCindiFowler & @CMDavidYates) voted against the tax increase. 

Barbara Shanklin voted yes. 

8 Democrats joined @LMCRep to defeat the proposal. #Louisville

text: Appears Metro Council members pretty much know there aren’t enough votes (14 are needed) to pass the current 10% insurance tax hike, and they’re looking for a way out. #Louisville

text:
.@DemLMC member Barbara Shanklin talking about the needs in her district from youth to seniors.

Shanklin wants to see the ordinance amended as @CMBrandonCoan suggested. #LouDistrict2
author: phillipmbailey

text:
.@CMBrandonCoan is calling to amend the ordinance so it will revert the insurance premium tax rate back to 5% after two years.

text:
Of the 26-member council, 10 @DemLMC have indicated they support a 10% tax hike, while 11 members — seven @LMCRep and four #Dems — have said they are opposed to that idea.

Watch 5 undecided (Democrats Barbara Shanklin, Keisha Dorsey, Mark Fox, @CWCindiFowler and @CMDavidYates).

text:
